title: Dr. Gupta calls WaPo White House report 'stunning'
description: CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta reacts to a report from the Washington Post that claims the White House stopped a plan by the United States Postal service to mail 650 million masks to Americans.

title: Trump administration to attempt to reimpose UN sanctions on Iran despite international opposition
description: The Trump administration will move to reimpose UN sanctions against Iran this weekend despite the fact that global allies and adversaries alike are set to effectively ignore the move.

title: White House tries to play defense with falsehoods about former Pence aide
US sending armored vehicles into Syria as Trump says 'we are out'
description: The US military announced Friday that it is deploying armored vehicles and other military assets to Syria to protect US troops fighting ISIS amid tensions with Russia as President Donald Trump told a White House news conference that "we are out of Syria," saying the remaining US forces are there exclusively "guarding the oil."

title: Joe Rogan spread dangerous misinformation about fires. Now he says he's sorry
description: Joe Rogan, reportedly the highest paid podcast host in the world, has apologized for spreading misinformation to his millions of listeners about the West Coast fires during a recent episode.

title: Ride along in the latest Ferrari convertible
description: A good Ferrari can be one of Italy's finest works of art. CNN Business' Peter Valdes-Dapena got to take the latest $300,000 Ferrari F8 Spider for a test drive.

title: Barr's latest comments have US Justice Department on edge
description: Attorney General William Barr's provocative critique of career employees who work for him and of politics surrounding Justice Department investigations is his clearest acknowledgment of a worsening divide between President Donald Trump's attorney general and his rank-and-file.

title: Brad Pitt and Jennifer Aniston recreate steamy movie scene
description: The actors appeared in a star-studded table read of "Fast Times at Ridgemont High" to benefit charity.

title: A carjacker held a couple hostage for hours before killing the husband, investigators say
description: Aileen and Jordan Stevens were driving to church on Sunday when a car rear-ended their Ford Mustang on Interstate 24 in Tennessee. It was about 9:30 a.m. -- Aileen Stevens was teaching Sunday School that morning at their church in Rutherford County, her family said.

title: Mediterranean hurricane makes landfall in Greece
description: A Mediterranean hurricane -- otherwise known as a 'Medicane' -- has made landfall over Greece's Lefkada Island at 4am UTC, according to the Hellenic National Meteorological Service.

title: Venus is a 'Russian planet', claims Russia
description: No longer confined to territories here on Earth, Russia has now staked its claim on Venus, saying it is a "Russian planet."

title: Hubble spies stormy weather on Jupiter
description: Each time the Hubble Space Telescope captures an image of the largest planet in our solar system, Jupiter looks a little different. This time, Hubble's weather report has shown new storms and updates on the Great Red Spot and its cousin.

title: Police charge Tesla driver who was allegedly doing 90mph while asleep
description: Canadian police have charged a 20-year-old man with dangerous driving after he was arrested for allegedly being asleep at the wheel of a 2019 Tesla Model S while it was operating in its semi-autonomous "Autopilot" mode.

title: Chrissy Teigen accidentally reveals the gender of baby #3
description: Chrissy Teigen let the cat out of the bag regarding her third pregnancy.

title: Firefighter dies in wildfire sparked by gender reveal party
description: A firefighter has been killed in the El Dorado Fire, the blaze sparked this month by a botched gender reveal party, according to the San Bernardino National Forest Service.

title: Van Morrison protests Covid-19 lockdowns in the UK in three new songs
description: Van Morrison is railing against UK lockdowns and pandemic restrictions in three new songs, despite the government's success at containing Covid-19 transmissions.

title: A deal to create Spain's largest lender could signal more bank mergers in Europe
description: Two big Spanish banks have announced a deal to create the country's largest domestic lender in a move that could signal the start of further consolidation in Europe's beleaguered banking sector.

title: From migrant to pop star: Tresor opens up about his 4,000-kilometer journey to fame
description: From a volcanic eruption that destroyed his home in the Democratic Republic of Congo, to experiencing devastating loss and setting off on his own in search of a fresh start in a new country, Tresor Riziki understands what it means to embrace second chances.

title: Soccer team loses 37-0 after practicing social distancing during game
description: You know what they say, safety always comes first.

title: 'I was born in Asbestos and want to die in Asbestos'
description: You'd think anything would be better than having your town named after a highly toxic building material, but the residents of Asbestos, Canada, might disagree.

title: Mariachi musicians fight pandemic blues in Mexico
description: Mariachi, a musical tradition in Mexico, and its musicians have been forced to adapt as crowded plazas are no longer safe during the coronavirus pandemic. CNN's Matt Rivers reports.

title: US to block access to TikTok and WeChat
What Trump revealed with a tweet
description: President Donald Trump loves Twitter, often tweeting countless times a day. In early September, the President tweeted his thoughts about how lucky the American people are to "have me as your President." Chris Cillizza explains the hidden meaning revealed in this tweet.

title: Japan reports record number of people aged 100 or older
description: Nearly 1 in 1,500 people in Japan is now aged 100 or older, new data from the Japanese government shows.

title: CNN anchor calls out Fox News guest's Covid-19 misinformation
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar says "misinformation is a virus unto itself and Fox News is the vector." She breaks down the misleading and false claims on the coronavius pandemic broadcast by the network.

title: Couple's 20-year search for extinct fruit finally pays off
description: On a crisp December afternoon, as the sun slowly fell behind the nearby Sawatch Range, Addie and Jude Schuenemeyer stared at a nearly dead tree, a few apples dangling off its last living branch.

title: Dentist who extracted tooth on a hoverboard sentenced to 12 years in jail
They sold their home before Covid hit. Now they're going to spend a year at sea
description: The oceans have emptied over the past few months, with seagoing voyagers around the world seeking safe harbor amid fears that Covid outbreaks or restrictions could leave them stranded with nowhere to go.

title: Scientists win award for giving an alligator helium and making it shout
description: A team of scientists who put an alligator in a helium-filled box and made it shout have won an Ig Nobel Prize, a prestigious(ish) award that commemorates the science world's more unorthodox experiments.

title: Justin Thomas leads U.S. Open with record first-round score
description: Winged Foot has a reputation as one of the toughest golf courses on the circuit, but American Justin Thomas made light work of the New York course on Thursday as he took an early lead of five-under at the U.S. Open.

title: The bees worth billions of dollars
description: Global honey bee populations are in decline, putting the world's food supply under pressure. But new technologies could help beekeepers counter the threat.

title: 5 takeaways from Joe Biden's CNN town hall
description: Facts First database | Campaign photos | Report your voting issues

title: Nurse arranges for a plane to fly a dying father to see his son play football one last time
description: For a father and son, a hug before the first game of football season is a special moment. For Scott and Cade Sullivan, it was the moment of a lifetime.

title: This Pacific Island province is so frustrated with China's presence that it's pushing for independence
description: It was pitched as a rare repatriation flight to bring people stranded in China back to their Pacific Island home which has yet to report a single coronavirus case.

title: How captivity saved these animals from extinction
description: A 130-year-old tortoise made headlines earlier this year, when it emerged that his prolific sex life had helped save his entire species from extinction in the wild.

title: Skeptical 'no-masker' pastor lands in ICU with Covid-19
description: A pastor in Idaho who called himself a "no-masker" during a service and repeatedly questioned the veracity of coronavirus case reporting is in the ICU after contracting Covid-19.

title: Former top Pence aide slams Trump and endorses Biden
description:
• GOP growing more indifferent to Trump controversies as election nears
• Ex-GOP chariman rips Trump supporters

title: Naomi Osaka will not play in the French Open
description: Less than a week after she won the US Open, three-time major champion Naomi Osaka of Japan announced on social media that she will not play in the French Open in Paris.

title: If you're caught here without a mask, you dig graves for Covid-19 victims
description: Villagers who refuse to wear masks are being forced to dig graves for victims of Covid-19 by local authorities in one part of rural Indonesia, in the hopes that a little bit of manual labor and empathy will convince others to do their part to help stop the pandemic.

title: Former top Pence aide slams Trump and endorses Biden
A 'very serious situation' is unfolding in Europe with 'alarming' rates of Covid spread, WHO warns
Yosemite National Park closes due to hazardous air quality from the wildfires
description: The beauty of Yosemite National Park in California can't escape the effects of the wildfires.
